char **query;
	query = (char**) malloc ( sizeof(char*) );

	int f=0;
	int i=0,j=0,c;


	while((c=getchar())!=EOF)
	{
		if(!isalpha(c))
			continue;

		if(f==1)
			query=(char**) realloc(query,(i+1)*sizeof(char*));

		query[i]=(char*) malloc(sizeof(char));
		query[i][j]=c;
		j++;

		
		while( (c=getchar())!=EOF&&c!=' '&&c!='\\t' )
		{

			query[i]=(char*) realloc(query[i],(j+1)*sizeof(char));

			query[i][j]=c;
			++j;
		}

		query[i][j]='\\0';
		printf("%s\\n",query[i]);
		if(c==EOF){
			
			break;
		}
		printf("eof\\n");

		++i;
		f=1;
		j=0;
	}

I want the above code snippet to read a line of strings seperated by spaces and tabs until ONE EOF but it requires 2 EOF to end the loop.
I am struggling on about 2 days.
Please, give some feedback.

    #include <stdio.h>
    #include <stdlib.h>
    #include <ctype.h>
    
    int main()
    {
    	int **list;
    	char **words;
        
    	words = (char**) malloc ( sizeof(char*) );
    	words[0]=(char*) malloc(sizeof(char));
    
    	list = ( int* * ) malloc ( sizeof(int*) );
    	list[0]=(int*) malloc(sizeof(int));
    
    	int n;
    	scanf("%d ",&n);
    	printf("\\nn=%d\\n",n);
    
    	int i=0,j=0;
    	int c=0;
    
    	while(i<n)
    	{
    		while((c=getchar())!=' '&&(c)!='\\t')
    		{
    			words[i][j]=c;
    			++j;
    
    			words[i]=(char*) realloc(words[i],(j+1)*sizeof(char));
    		}
    		words[i][j]='\\0';
    
    		printf("%s\\n",words[i]);
    
    		j=0;
    		int m;
    		scanf("%d ",&m);
    		printf("m=%d\\n",m);
    		while(j<m)
    		{
    			if(i==n-1&&j==m-1)									
    				scanf("%d",&list[i][j]);							
    			else
    				scanf("%d ",&list[i][j]);
    			printf("%d ",list[i][j]);
    			++j;
    			if(j!=m)
    				list[i]=(int*) realloc(list[i],(j+1)*sizeof(int));
    		}
    
    		
    
    		++i;
    		j=0;
    		if(i!=n)
    		{
    			words=(char**) realloc(words,(i+1)*sizeof(char*));
    			words[i]=(char*) malloc( sizeof(char) );
    
    			list=(int**) realloc(list,(i+1)*sizeof(int*));
    			list[i]=(int*) malloc(sizeof(int));
    		}
    	}
    	//NO PROBLEM
    
    	
    
    	char **query;
    	query = (char**) malloc ( sizeof(char*) );
    
    	int f=0;
    	i=0,j=0;
    
    
    	while((c=getchar())!=EOF)
    	{
    		if(!isalpha(c))
    			continue;
    		printf("c=%c\\n",c);
    
    		if(f==1)
    			query=(char**) realloc(query,(i+1)*sizeof(char*));
    
    		query[i]=(char*) malloc(sizeof(char));
    		query[i][j]=c;
    		j++;
    
    		
    		while( (c=getchar())!=EOF&&c!=' '&&c!='\\t' )
    		{
    
    			query[i]=(char*) realloc(query[i],(j+1)*sizeof(char));
    
    			query[i][j]=c;
    			++j;
    		}
    
    		query[i][j]='\\0';
    		printf("%s\\n",query[i]);
    		if(c==EOF){
    			
    			break;
    		}
    		printf("eof\\n");
    
    		++i;
    		f=1;
    		j=0;
    	}
    
    	
    
    	return 0;
    }
